intro: Haplopappus pulchellus, commonly known as the beautiful pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, flat-topped inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a rough texture. Haplopappus pulchellus is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
